title: Add file/stdout output mode
body:
Closes #45 

This PR adds a new output mode for `jail_exporter`, allowing the metrics to either be written directly to a file on a filesystem, or output to stdout.
The purpose of this is to allow an administrator to reduce the number of network daemons they have running. The intended way to make use of this mode is to pair it with the "Textfile Collector" of `node_exporter`.

title: build(deps): bump actix-web from 1.0.7 to 1.0.8

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [actix-web](https://github.com/actix/actix-web) from 1.0.7 to 1.0.8.
Release notes *Sourced from [actix-web's releases](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/releases).* > ## Actix web v1.0.8 > ## Changes > > ### Added > > * Add `Scope::register_data` and `Resource::register_data` methods, parallel to > `App::register_data`. > > * Add `middleware::Condition` that conditionally enables another middleware > > * Allow to re-construct `ServiceRequest` from `HttpRequest` and `Payload` > > * Add `HttpServer::listen_uds` for ability to listen on UDS FD rather than path, > which is useful for example with systemd. > > ### Changed > > * Make UrlEncodedError::Overflow more informativve > > * Use actix-testing for testing utils
Changelog *Sourced from [actix-web's changelog](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/blob/master/CHANGES.md).* > ## [1.0.8] - 2019-09-25 > > ### Added > > * Add `Scope::register_data` and `Resource::register_data` methods, parallel to > `App::register_data`. > > * Add `middleware::Condition` that conditionally enables another middleware > > * Allow to re-construct `ServiceRequest` from `HttpRequest` and `Payload` > > * Add `HttpServer::listen_uds` for ability to listen on UDS FD rather than path, > which is useful for example with systemd. > > ### Changed > > * Make UrlEncodedError::Overflow more informativve > > * Use actix-testing for testing utils
Commits - [`4f3e97f`](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/commit/4f3e97fff800267c6c21440540d6c01a4f297538) prepare actix-web release - [`3ff01a9`](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/commit/3ff01a9fc487d729781c4206ab3c9ea920c8c23b) Add changelog entry for [#1101](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/actix/actix-web/issues/1101) ([#1102](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/actix/actix-web/issues/1102)) - [`3d4e45a`](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/commit/3d4e45a0e56979ba2f316e752e399f1ccb35154f) prepare release - [`c659c33`](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/commit/c659c33919c4880dbe3d220773f20fc6c5b58070) Feature uds: Add listen_uds to ServerBuilder ([#1085](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/actix/actix-web/issues/1085)) - [`959f775`](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/commit/959f7754b267ed4a7a33eb585b9d79aa3977039b) Merge pull request [#1101](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/actix/actix-web/issues/1101) from actix/add-awc-get-head-methods - [`23f04c4`](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/commit/23f04c4f38ee3ff47eafb2f26338e2e6561f591e) Add remaining getter methods from private head field - [`d9af8f6`](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/commit/d9af8f66ba7ab645f160ee195136fcd1147cea99) Use actix-testing for testing utils - [`aa39b8c`](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/commit/aa39b8ca6fe7160446cc1adbd943c63014413e30) Add support for serde_json::Value to be passed as argument to ResponseBuilder... - [`58c7065`](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/commit/58c7065f08dddb2a9370eee468a10aa29d8cd641) Implement `register_data` method on `Resource` and `Scope`. ([#1094](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/actix/actix-web/issues/1094)) - [`b3783b4`](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/commit/b3783b403e0e7d9f6fa85f5fff0bf5d306460d49) Merge branch 'master' of github.com:actix/actix-web - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/compare/web-v1.0.7...web-v1.0.8)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=actix-web&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=1.0.7&new-version=1.0.8)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=actix-web&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=1.0.7&new-version=1.0.8) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: build(deps): bump env_logger from 0.6.2 to 0.7.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [env_logger](https://github.com/sebasmagri/env_logger) from 0.6.2 to 0.7.0.
Release notes *Sourced from [env_logger's releases](https://github.com/sebasmagri/env_logger/releases).* > ## 0.7.0 > # Key Changes > > - Indent multiline messages by default > - Support more timestamp precision > - Update to the 2018 edition > > # Changes to minimum Rust > > The minimum version of Rust required has been set at `1.31.0`. We may change this in patch versions, but will always flag it in the release notes here. > > You can always check the `.travis.yml` file to see the current minimum supported version. > > # Contributions > > - [@​95ulisse](https://github.com/95ulisse) [Indentation for multiline log messages](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sebasmagri/env_logger/pull/134) > - [@​oherrala](https://github.com/oherrala) [Add more timestamp precisions](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sebasmagri/env_logger/pull/140) > - [Update to 2018 edition](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sebasmagri/env_logger/pull/142)

title: build(deps): bump actix-http-test from 0.2.4 to 0.2.5

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [actix-http-test](https://github.com/actix/actix-web) from 0.2.4 to 0.2.5.
Release notes *Sourced from [actix-http-test's releases](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/releases).* > ## Actix http 0.2.5 > ## Changes > > ### Added > > * Add `on-connect` callback, `HttpServiceBuilder::on_connect()` [#946](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/actix/actix-web/issues/946) > > ### Changed > > * Use `encoding_rs` crate instead of unmaintained `encoding` crate > > * Add `Copy` and `Clone` impls for `ws::Codec` > > ## Actix http client v0.2.5 > ## Changes > > ### Added > > * Add `FrozenClientRequest` to support retries for sending HTTP requests > > ### Changed > > * Ensure that the `Host` header is set when initiating a WebSocket client connection. > > ## Actix http test v0.2.5 > ## Changes > > ### Changed > > * Update serde_urlencoded to "0.6.1" > > ### Fixed > > * Do not override current `System`

title: build(deps): bump indoc from 0.3.3 to 0.3.4

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [indoc](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc) from 0.3.3 to 0.3.4.
Release notes *Sourced from [indoc's releases](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/releases).* > ## 0.3.4 > - Update to Syn 1.0
Commits - [`f81bac8`](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/commit/f81bac8b6e6eb98c2403cae4d32b060ca7dd5f89) Release 0.3.4 - [`ed2a484`](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/commit/ed2a4844d25874c616564f12681b64c7408b840f) Update to syn 1.0 - [`ba202e8`](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/commit/ba202e8132480ab6daef96419f0b643f124454ba) Just use default features, we need almost all - [`5fe0072`](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/commit/5fe0072b943c3ed10b729e95030fd37a15f09d5a) Need proc_macro to proc_macro2 TokenStream conversion - [`5e76d14`](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/commit/5e76d1481b4136457ed47b4ac11b585929073738) Switch to rustversion - [`210fed6`](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/commit/210fed6cd870e1f84ca19f493edc218b23257413) Smaller format for license section - [`4d89bfd`](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/commit/4d89bfd4c1eaefcf6e2ee841663167077a4bab10) Switch to SPDX 2.1 license expression - [`fd01e59`](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/commit/fd01e59ef3ae2ba9fc71769498d8e738e38aed80) Don't require minimal-versions support for dev dependencies - [`e482e84`](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/commit/e482e847d312ef943e4ef747b7d3183105ccedf9) Flatten tests into main crate - [`99b86c7`](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/commit/99b86c77f177a0af078ff2e3aadf510b5305aa28) Switch ui tests to trybuild - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/dtolnay/indoc/compare/0.3.3...0.3.4)

title: build(deps): [security] bump spin from 0.5.1 to 0.5.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: security
labels.description: Pull requests that address a security vulnerability

body:
Bumps [spin](https://github.com/mvdnes/spin-rs) from 0.5.1 to 0.5.2. **This update includes security fixes.**
Vulnerabilities fixed *Sourced from [The RustSec Advisory Database](https://github.com/RustSec/advisory-db/blob/master/crates/spin/RUSTSEC-2019-0013.toml).* > **Wrong memory orderings in RwLock potentially violates mutual exclusion** > Wrong memory orderings inside the RwLock implementation allow for two writers to acquire the lock at the same time. The drop implementation used Ordering::Relaxed, which allows the compiler or CPU to reorder a mutable access on the locked data after the lock has been yielded. > > Only users of the RwLock implementation are affected. Users of Once (including users of lazy_static with the `spin_no_std` feature enabled) are NOT affected. > > On strongly ordered CPU architectures like x86, the only real way that this would lead to a memory corruption is if the compiler reorders an access after the lock is yielded, which is possible but in practice unlikely. It is a more serious issue on weakly ordered architectures such as ARM which, except in the presence of certain instructions, allow the hardware to decide which accesses are seen at what times. Therefore on an ARM system it is likely that using the wrong memory ordering would result in a memory corruption, even if the compiler itself doesn't reorder the memory accesses in a buggy way. > > The flaw was corrected by https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/mvdnes/spin-rs/pull/66. > > Patched versions: >= 0.5.2 > Unaffected versions: none *Sourced from [The RustSec Advisory Database](https://github.com/RustSec/advisory-db/blob/master/crates/spin/RUSTSEC-0000-0000.toml).* > **Wrong memory orderings in RwLock potentially violates mutual exclusion** > Wrong memory orderings inside the RwLock implementation allow for two writers to acquire the lock at the same time. The drop implementation used Ordering::Relaxed, which allows the compiler or CPU to reorder a mutable access on the locked data after the lock has been yielded. > > Only users of the RwLock implementation are affected. Users of Once (including users of lazy_static with the `spin_no_std` feature enabled) are NOT affected. > > On strongly ordered CPU architectures like x86, the only real way that this would lead to a memory corruption is if the compiler reorders an access after the lock is yielded, which is possible but in practice unlikely. It is a more serious issue on weakly ordered architectures such as ARM which, except in the presence of certain instructions, allow the hardware to decide which accesses are seen at what times. Therefore on an ARM system it is likely that using the wrong memory ordering would result in a memory corruption, even if the compiler itself doesn't reorder the memory accesses in a buggy way. > > The flaw was corrected by https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/mvdnes/spin-rs/pull/66. > > Patched versions: >= 0.5.2 > Unaffected versions: none
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/mvdnes/spin-rs/commits)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=spin&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.5.1&new-version=0.5.2)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=spin&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.5.1&new-version=0.5.2) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) Dependabot will merge this PR once CI passes on it, as requested by @phyber. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

title: Use jail 0.1.0
body: Now that #29 is fixed in `jail` v0.1.0, you do no longer need to use the `dev` branch (#30)

title: Use dev branch of libjail to temporarily solve compilation issues
body: Fixes #29 by using the `dev` branch of libjail until the next release.

title: src/httpd: Use mime crate for content types.
body:
Resolves #26 by using the `mime` crate for content types.
Not merging until the `type_length_limit` issue is fixed and tests work again.
